newsitem.title: USA: Novoste Corp says Beta-Cath praised.
newsitem.headline: Novoste Corp says Beta-Cath praised.

text.p: Novoste Corp said on Tuesday that its Beta-Cath system for treating restenosis was praised by a researcher during an American College of Cardiology meeting.
Novoste, of Norcross, Ga., said Beta-Cath was given high marks by Dr. Spencer King, who is involved in a Novoste-sponsored study of Beta-Cath's effectiveness.
Restenosis occurs when an artery that previously had been treated -- for instance, by angioplasty -- grows narrow again.

King said that in a feasibility clinical trial of Beta-Cath, preliminary data indicate that "there was a very low restenosis rate and a remarkable lack of late lumen loss, which I have never seen before with other treatments."
"That means," he said, "that the artery maintained most of the benefits of the initial balloon angioplasty, even without the use of additional devices or therapies."
Novoste expects to begin a larger, multicenter trial of the radiation treatment in the second quarter of 1997.
